Hello everyone. We have some general announcements regarding graduation!

PISD Administration will meet at 7:30am to make the inclement weather call. If a call is made, all information (call out and social media) will be sent out at 8:00am.

No delay graduation starts at the regularly scheduled time at 10:00am.

The delayed start is at 2:00pm.

If the weather is too bad to have it outside, graduation will be moved to the Wayland Baptist University Hutcherson Center with a 6:00pm start time. Each person who enters the Center will need a ticket. Each graduate received 8 tickets at graduation practice.

We will keep everyone posted through our call-out system and social media. PISD thanks you for your understanding!

Plainview ISD relays the following information regarding the 2019 Graduation Ceremony. Please review the information below.

In the event that inclement weather impacts the scheduled start time, the ceremony will be rescheduled to begin at a later time. In the event the graduation ceremony cannot be held at Bulldog Stadium, graduation will be moved to Hutcherson Center at Wayland Baptist University.

The Hutcherson Center at Wayland Baptist University does not have a functioning air conditioner. We will make graduation as honorable as possible as well as accommodate PISD guests.

Any changes regarding graduation time will be communicated to students and parents by School Messenger, Remind 101, and PISD Facebook. The changes will also be posted on the Plainview ISD Facebook page.

The course cost $250 and is cash only all dues are required at registration: no exceptions. Requirements for class:
- Full attendance from May 28th-June 26th 8:30 a.m. - 10:30 a.m.

Needed before class is over:
- Original Birth Certificate: must have to receive DE certificate.
- Original Social Security Card: must have to receive DE certificate
- Glasses if applicable
- Verification of Enrollment (provided by the school)

post_text: Plainview High School Student Council achieved their 11th sweepstakes with the Texas Association of Student Councils. Plainview High StuCo was awarded with outstanding student council, outstanding drugs, alcohol, safety and health, outstanding energy and environment, outstanding pride and patriotism, outstanding community service. Student councils are required to raise money in donations and dedicate their time in all types of projects in order to achieve these awards. This year’s student council completed 3391 hours. The officers that lead this group were president, Alyssa Hurta, vice president, Austin Miller, secretary, Hannah Massingill, treasurer, Lauren Hukill, and Parlimentarian, Mitchell Sims.

post_text: We are excited to welcome Coach Villa as the head coach for the Lady Bulldog's Softball team. We wish you the best!
shared_text:
Bulldog Athletics - Angry Red, 'Nuff Said is with Enrique Villa.
May 9, 2019 at 7:33 PM ·

The Plainview Athletic Department and Plainview ISD are proud to announce the hiring of Enrique Villa as the new head softball coach for the Lady Dogs. Coach Villa is a graduate of Fort Stockton HS and Texas Tech University. He is married to Sandra Villa and is the proud parent of Analisa, Andrew, Adam, and Abram. Coach Villa has been a coach and teacher in Plainview since the fall of 2012. He has had previous head coaching stops at Ferris HS and most recently West Mesquite HS. We are overjoyed to find a coach who meets so many of the qualifications which were important to our community on staff already. We eagerly anticipate seeing the wonderful things which will occur with Coach Villa and his staff building on the tradition of Lady Dog Softball. GBR!
